alert.note: Alert for Davidson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 9:37PM EDT until August 26 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Davidson. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 937 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lexington, Linwood, Denton, Gordontown, High Rock Lake Marina & Campground and High Rock Lake. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
